page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: An Interview. We interviewed our school cook, Mrs Rowcliffe and assistant cook, Mrs Enticott. They said that Ashbrittle has changed a lot over the years. They said that an old witch used to live in Mrs Enticott's house. Mrs Enticott keeps hearing strange noises. There was also a man who had great power in the village. If he couldn't get rid of someone he didn't like, he had been known to even have their house pulled down. Four very popular games were hoops, hop scotch, marbles and skipping. You could get Horlicks for half a penny and a quarter of a pound of sweets for three old pence. There was a bus for going to the cinema, on Wednesdays and Saturdays.
